page.title: 15Description of Catthorpe
page.content: Catthorpe is a small quiet village, without a shop or Post Office,which since 1973 has had a preservation order placed on it to maintain its present features.This was due to the possibility of land being sold to develop a new town,resulting in most of the native population leaving the area.Only 3 of the original families remain,all of whom are farmers,the other villagers having various occupations outside the community. There are 36 established dwellings, ranging from a terraced cottage to a mansion,which provide homes for a fluctuating population which at the moment is 111 people. To the eastern end of Main St. is a small industry-Medix Ltd.-which supply medical equipment.
